LanguageData.settings.PreventAnimalFamilies.tooltip: Prevents animals from gaining parent relations and birth stories for art. This prevents late game performance issues due to family trees with hundreds of members.
LanguageData.settings.UseFixedNumericTextfields.toolt: Easier to use numeric inputs that don't restrict the typing of numbers. Inside this mod they are always used. With this option activated they replace all default inputs as well.
LanguageData.settings.CuMBaseCost.tooltip: When changing features of a colonist the changes are priced through a factor and this base cost. Setting it to 0 allows to modify colonists for free.
LanguageData.settings.CuMConversionPawn.tooltip: Setting this to a value above 0 means you can add surplus points to a shared pool that other colonists can use. At 1 it becomes lossless.
LanguageData.settings.CuMConversionRemnants.tooltip: When abondaning a colony with colonists in it the point value of each abandoned colonist is added to a shared pool that other colonists can use.
LanguageData.settings.RemnantsOrderPriceFactor.toolti: When placing a custom order with a remnant colony you have to provide materials and silver. This changes how much of the market price must be paid in addition to providing the materials.
LanguageData.settings.ForbiddenPatches.tooltip: If you think you encountered a mod conflict with this mod you can deactivate various parts to prevent them. Changes apply only after restarting the game.
LanguageData.traitCosts.Cost.tooltip: A factor to the CuM base cost defined in the general settings that determines the price for each trait when adding it to a colonist. In order to remove a trait the negated price must be paid. Therefore good traits use positive values and bad traits use negative values.
LanguageData.traitCosts.RemovalCost.tooltip: Replaces the cost factor during removal of a trait if this value is not zero.
LanguageData.recordFactors.Factor.tooltip: The value in the colonists record is multiplied by the corresponding factor to determine how many points are available to customize the colonist.
LanguageData.powerBuildings.BasePower.tooltip: The base power determines how much power is consumed by a building with a fixed power consumption/generation. Buildings that consume/generate a variable amount of power are unaffected.
LanguageData.mainButtons.Visible.tooltip: Whether a button should be displayed in the bottom menu or not.
LanguageData.mainButtons.Order.tooltip: A value determining which button is displayed first. Leftmost is the lowest value and rightmost the highest.
LanguageData.architectButtons.Visible.tooltip: Wheter a button should be displayed in the architect menu or not.
LanguageData.architectButtons.Order.tooltip: A value determining which button is displayed first. Bottom right is the lowest value and top left is the highest.
LanguageData.recipes.LearnFactor.tooltip: Multiplier for experience gained while working on this recipe. Recipes that have unfinished products award experience as the pawn works on it. Other recipes award experience when the recipe finishes. Experience gained is proportional to time spent working on the recipe. So better workers gain less experience.
LanguageData.recipes.WorkSkill.tooltip: This skill will be awarded the experience gained from this recipe. Selecting no skill will disable experience gain.
LanguageData.recipes.WorkSpeedStat.tooltip: This stat is used to measure how fast a worker can complete the recipe. Selecting no stat means no one gains bonuses to workspeed. No stat is useful for training recipes, since faster completion awards less experience.
LanguageData.recipes.Products.tooltip: Amount and type of things spawned on completion of the recipe. This works for any recipe, so you can spawn human flesh on installing a prosthesis.
LanguageData.floorsAndTerrain.Cleanliness.tooltip: Positive values increase a rooms cleanliness rating and as such improve surgery success and reduce infection chance.
LanguageData.floorsAndTerrain.PathCost.tooltip: Cost in game turns to cross this terrain.
LanguageData.floorsAndTerrain.ExtraDraftedPerceivedPa: Additional cost in game turns to cross this terrain if the pawn moving through is drafted. This is used on water to discourage soldiers from walking through terrain that debuffs them.
LanguageData.floorsAndTerrain.ExtraNonDraftedPerceive: Additional cost in game turns to cross this terrain if the pawn moving through isn't drafted. This is used on water to discourage civilians from walking through terrain that debuffs them.
LanguageData.floorsAndTerrain.FilthTerrain.tooltip: Whether this terrain accepts filth generated by terrain.
LanguageData.floorsAndTerrain.Filth.tooltip: Whether this terrain accepts filth generated by other sources than terrain. Animals giving birth, people bleeding, vomiting etc..
LanguageData.thoughts.MultiplyingStat.tooltip: This stat will modify the base mood offset.
LanguageData.thoughts.NextThought.tooltip: A followup thought, like the catharsis after a mental break.
LanguageData.thoughts.StackLimit.tooltip: How many instances of this thought can exist on a single pawn.
LanguageData.thoughts.StackLimitPerPawn.tooltip: How many instances of this thought can exist on a single pawn that are referencing the same pawn.
LanguageData.thoughts.StackedEffectMultiplier.tooltip: This multiplier reducces the mood and opinion values of additional instances. Each instance applies multiplier^(n-1) of its values. With a multiplier of 0.8 the first one applies 100%, the second 80% and the third 64%.
LanguageData.thoughts.MaximumCumulatedOpinion.tooltip: If a thought can be merged with an existing thought no new instance is created, instead the opinion of the existing thought is increased. This setting defines the maximum for a merged opinion. Merging circumvents all stack settings!
LanguageData.thoughts.Stages.tooltip: Each thought has exactly one stage active. All stages share the thought settings.
LanguageData.thoughtStage.BaseMoodEffect.tooltip: Setting the mood effect to something other than 0 shows the thought in the needs tab. Every thought can have a mood effect.
LanguageData.thoughtStage.BaseOpinionOffset.tooltip: Only thoughts between pawns, aka social, support opinion offsets.
LanguageData.thoughtStage.Visible.tooltip: Whether or not the thought should be listed in the needs tab.
LanguageData.apparel.wearPerDay.tooltip: Worn equipment takes this much damage every day(every 60000 turns).
LanguageData.apparel.equippedStatOffsets.tooltip: Stat modifiers that apply to the wearer.
LanguageData.apparel.statBases.tooltip: Stat modifiers that apply to this item.
LanguageData.weapons.WarmupTime.tooltip: Time it takes to aim until the first shot is fired. Cooldown for ranged weapons is defined as an item stat and cooldown for melee attacks is defined in tools.
LanguageData.weapons.MinRange.tooltip: Minimal targetable distance between cells using the hypotenuse.
LanguageData.weapons.Range.tooltip: Maximal targetable distance between cells using the hypotenuse.
LanguageData.weapons.ForcedMissRadius.tooltip: The value defines how much a shot scatters from its target. The value is staggered based on the distance of the shot. 0-9 = no scatter, 9-25 = half, 25-49 = 80%, 49+ = 100% Then it must be above 0.5 to force a scatter. The projectile will then target a random cell within the radius defined by the staggered value around the original target. 2 would mean past 8 cells the shot can be 1 cell off.
LanguageData.weapons.BurstShotCount.tooltip: How many shots are fired in one burst.
LanguageData.weapons.TicksBetweenBurstShots.tooltip: Turns between consecutive shots in a burst.
LanguageData.weapons.DefaultProjectile.tooltip: The projectile fired determines most stats for ranged weapons. Most guns will therefore have their own projectile definition.
LanguageData.weapons.Tools.tooltip: Melee attacks that are possible with this weapon.
LanguageData.toolSettings.Power.tooltip: Base power that gets modified by the "MeleeWeapon_DamageMultiplier" item stat. If the weapon was crafted with a material that materials matching damage type multiplier is applied as well.
LanguageData.toolSettings.Cooldown.tooltip: Base cooldown time that is adjusted by the "MeleeWeapon_CooldownMultiplier" item stat.
LanguageData.projectiles.FlyOverhead.tooltip: Projectile acts like a mortar. Roofing over the target gets hit but things in between are safe.
LanguageData.projectiles.StoppingPower.tooltip: If the stopping power is at least equal to the body size of the target, the target is staggered.
LanguageData.projectiles.ArmorPenetrationBase.tooltip: Armor penetration reduces the armor rating before applying damage.
LanguageData.plants.PathCostIgnoreRepeat.tooltip: When a pawn is moving between "ignore repeaters" they do not add their path cost.
LanguageData.plants.FertilityMin.tooltip: The terrain must have at least this much fertility to allow planting.
LanguageData.plants.FertilitySensitivity.tooltip: How much the terrains fertility accounts for. At 0 the fertility is always 100%. At 1.0 the fertility always matches the terrains fertility. Formula: terrainFertility * sensitivity + 1 - sensitivity
LanguageData.plants.MustBeWildToSow.tooltip: If this is turned off a plant can be planted in biomes that it normally wouldn't grow.
LanguageData.plants.HarvestMinGrowth.tooltip: How much the plant must have grown before being harvestable.
LanguageData.plants.VisualSizeRangeMin.tooltip: How big the plant is rendered at minimum growth.
LanguageData.plants.VisualSizeRangeMax.tooltip: How big the plant is rendered at maximum growth.
LanguageData.material.PathCost.tooltip: Additional turns taken to cross a cell with this item laying inside it.
LanguageData.material.DeepCommonality.tooltip: How common the item appears in the depth layer of a newly generated map.
LanguageData.material.DeepCountPerPortion.tooltip: How much is extracted with a single deep drill action.
LanguageData.material.DeepCountPerCell.tooltip: How much is stored in a single deep cell when the resource is generated.
LanguageData.material.DeepLumpSizeMin.tooltip: How many cells are at least generated with this resource when a vein is created.
LanguageData.material.DeepLumpSizeMax.tooltip: How many cells are at most generated with this resource when a vein is created.
LanguageData.material.statBases.tooltip: Stats that define the item itself, NOT items made from this.
LanguageData.material.Smeltable.tooltip: Allows smeltable things made from this material to be smelted or not.
LanguageData.material.Commonality.tooltip: How often the item appears in places like trader inventory or random loot.
LanguageData.material.Color.tooltip: Color associated with the material in menues and things made of this. Useless if the material uses a random color generator.
LanguageData.material.StatFactors.tooltip: A multiplicative value that modifies the stats of things made from this.
LanguageData.material.StatOffsets.tooltip: A flat value that modifies the stats of things made from this.
LanguageData.food.PathCost.tooltip: Additional turns taken to cross a cell with this item laying inside it.
LanguageData.food.DeepCommonality.tooltip: How common the item appears in the depth layer of a newly generated map.
LanguageData.food.DeepCountPerPortion.tooltip: How much is extracted with a single deep drill action.
LanguageData.food.DeepCountPerCell.tooltip: How much is stored in a single deep cell when the resource is generated.
LanguageData.food.DeepLumpSizeMin.tooltip: How many cells are at least generated with this resource when a vein is created.
LanguageData.food.DeepLumpSizeMax.tooltip: How many cells are at most generated with this resource when a vein is created.
LanguageData.food.statBases.tooltip: Stats that define the item itself, NOT items made from this.
LanguageData.food.MaxNumToIngestAtOnce.tooltip: Maximum number of instances of this item to eat in one go.
LanguageData.food.BaseIngestTicks.tooltip: How much work is required to eat the item.
LanguageData.food.ChairSearchRadius.tooltip: How far the eater will search for a chair. A search radius below or at 10 will not cause "Ate without a table" or "Impressive dining hall" thoughts.
LanguageData.food.UseEatingSpeedStat.tooltip: If true then the work is amount is modified by the eaters eating speed stat.
LanguageData.food.IngestHoldUsesTable.tooltip: Whether a pawn will face a table surface when eating a held item next to one.
LanguageData.food.Joy.tooltip: How much joy is generated by eating this item.
LanguageData.food.Nurseable.tooltip: Wheter a drug can be consumed during a social relaxation.
LanguageData.food.JoyKind.tooltip: Which category of joy is filled with the value specified in "Joy".
